definition: Himalayas
pinyin: Xi3 ma3 la1 ya3 shan1 mai4

definition: to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
elegant
surname Shan
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
see 脈脈|脉脉[mo4 mo4]
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)
old variant of 脈|脉[mai4]
variant of 脈|脉[mai4]

sentences.chinese: 喜马拉雅山脉农家，卡林，不丹，1989。

sentences.english: India has pushed hard into Asia, pushing up the Himalaya Mountains.
sentences.chinese: 印度板块艰难地挤向亚洲板块，形成了喜马拉雅山脉。

sentences.english: This temperature drop was triggered by the rise of the Himalayas.
sentences.chinese: 气温下降是由喜马拉雅山脉隆起所致。

sentences.english: Beyond theHimalayas, both countries are enlarging their ecological footprint in Asia.
sentences.chinese: 在喜马拉雅山脉以外，两国都在亚洲扩大其生态足迹。

sentences.english: Mount Gaoligong is a southern extension on the east side of the Himalayas.
sentences.chinese: 高黎贡山是喜马拉雅山脉的东部南延部分。

sentences.english: At the same time, the Beatles flew to foothills of the Himalayas to learn meditation.
sentences.chinese: 同时，披头们飞到喜马拉雅山脉的山麓下，学习冥想。

sentences.english: The Himalayas the Alps the Bermudas The Himalayas have a magnificent variety of plant .
sentences.chinese: 喜马拉雅山脉有大量各种各样的植物。

definition: Himalayas
Gangdisê mountain range in southwest Tibet
Karakorum mountain range in west Xinjiang

Hengduan mountains, several parallel mountain ranges on the border between west Yunnan and Sichuan and east Tibet
the roof of the world/usually refers to Tibet or Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau 青藏高原[Qing1 Zang4 gao1 yuan2]
Dangla or Tanggula mountain range on the Qinhai-Tibet plateau
Pamir high plateau on the border between Xinjiang and Tajikistan
Qinghai-Tibetan plateau

Dangla or Tanggula mountain range on the Qinhai-Tibet plateau
the Andes mountain range

Mt Gang Rinpoche in Tibet/also called Mount Kailash
